info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 9:35PM CST until January 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...The Oklahoma Panhandle and the northern Texas Panhandle. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia and could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the lowest wind chill values will occur during the overnight period each day of the warning.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
